title: Math 4 Vol 2
text: HMH into Math 4

title: Unit 4: Fractions and Decimals
text: Modules in this Unit

title: Unit 4: Fractions and Decimals
text:
🧠 Module 10: Algebraic Thinking: Number Theory


Explore number patterns, factors, and multiples to build algebraic reasoning skills.

Start Module 10



🟰 Module 11: Fraction Equivalence and Comparison


Understand how to determine equivalent fractions and compare their values with visual models and number lines.

Start Module 11



🔢 Module 12: Relate Fractions and Decimals


Learn how fractions and decimals are connected, and how to convert between them.

Start Module 12



🧭 Module 13: Use Fractions to Understand Angles


Discover how to measure and interpret angles using fractional parts of a circle.

Start Module 13

title: Unit 5: Operations with Fractions
text: Modules in this Unit

title: Unit 5: Operations with Fractions
text:
➕ Module 14: Understand Addition and Subtraction of Fractions with Like Denominators


Learn the foundations of adding and subtracting fractions that share the same denominator using visual models.

Start Module 14



➗ Module 15: Add and Subtract Fractions and Mixed Numbers with Like Denominators


Extend your understanding to operations with mixed numbers, using models and number lines for support.

Start Module 15



✖️ Module 16: Multiply Fractions by Whole Numbers


Explore how to multiply a fraction by a whole number using models, repeated addition, and problem-solving.

Start Module 16

title: Unit 6: Two-Dimensional Figures and Symmetry
text: Modules in this Unit

title: Unit 6: Two-Dimensional Figures and Symmetry
text:
🔷 Module 17: Two-Dimensional Figures


Classify and understand properties of 2D shapes, including angles, sides, and types of polygons.

Start Module 17



🔁 Module 18: Symmetry and Patterns


Explore line symmetry and identify patterns in geometric figures through visual exploration and analysis.

Start Module 18

title: Unit 7: Measurement, Data, and Time
text: Modules in this Unit

title: Unit 7: Measurement, Data, and Time
text:
📏 Module 19: Relative Sizes of Customary Measurement Units


Understand and compare customary units of length, weight, and capacity in real-world contexts.

Start Module 19



📐 Module 20: Relative Sizes of Metric Measurement Units


Compare and convert between metric units of length, mass, and volume using place value relationships.

Start Module 20



⏰ Module 21: Solve Problems with Time and Measurement


Apply knowledge of time, intervals, and measurement to solve multi-step real-life problems.

Start Module 21
